result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence J. Sobczak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence J. Sobczak was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Serve 14 days in the Richland County Jail with work release and 0 days credit.  Jail to begin immediately.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse education class.

Do not possess or consume alcohol.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

No contact with the victim as named in the complaint.

Counsel stipulate to 1 day credit in the event of revocation.

Defendant to pay supervision costs.  Court costs to be removed from posted cash bond.

timeConds.notes: With work release and 0 days credit.  Jail to begin immediately.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence J. Sobczak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. 15CM164 and 15CM165.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 1 of 15CM165 for dismissal of 15CM164 and for dismissal of count 2.  Agreed-upon dispo is 18 months probation with 14 days jail and d.a. class as well as AODA/follow through and costs.  Def pleads no contest to count 1 of 15CM165.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Victim addresses the Court.  Sentence withheld for probation of 2 years with conditions to include 14 days in the county jail, d.a. class, AODA/follow through, no drink. Defense requests stay of jail until warmer weather.  ADA opposes jail stay request; also asks for no contact as part of probation.  Court orders no contact condition as part of the probation.  Court denies request for the stay.  Def is remanded to the custody of the sheriff.   1 day credit in the event of revocation.  Work release granted. 

15CM164 dismissed.  15CM165 count 2 dismissed.  

Costs to be paid as condition of probation.

Atty. M asks that the Court reconsider the request for stay of jail.  Request denied.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak in court.  Plea/sentencing requested and set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  15CM164 and 165.  Atty. M states ADA recently provided an offer; defense needs time to contemplate the offer.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lawrence J. Sobczak in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Initials in both 15CM164 and 15CM165.  Court states charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  NG pleas entered.  Status requested and set.  Atty. M notes no contact prohibition in these matters has been dropped via stip/order.  Court confirms.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion and order to amend court ordered 'no contact' prohibition and order
from SPD re. moving init appr from 09/15 to 09/22
